intro: Dichrotrichum borneense, commonly known as the Bornean dichrotrichum, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes grass-like plants and some aquatic species. The plant is characterized by its erect, slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in spikes and are typically white or pale blue in color. Dichrotrichum borneense is adapted to the humid, shaded environments of tropical lowland forests.
